title: Adjective + て + B

patterns: ［い］Adjective［い］ + く + て［な］Adjective + で + PhraseNoun + で + Phrase

variants.standard: ［い］Adjective［い］ + く + て［な］Adjective + で + PhraseNoun + で + Phrase

cautions: Caution Like other て forms (ている 1, ている 2, and ている 3), the て (or で) form of other words can have several possible meanings. These meanings are as follows. Linking - Like 'and' in English. Reasons - Like 'with (A)', or 'because of (A)' in English. Manner - Like 'to do (B) in an (A) way' in English.
Caution As with all other conjugations of いい, remember that it will be よくて, and not いくて.
about: The て form of an い-Adjective , or で form of a noun (or な-Adjective ) is exactly the same as the て form of a verb, in that it carries the meaning of 'and', and is used for linking. Building on from the adjective +て, noun + で grammar point, instead of linking adjectives, adjective + て + (B) is used for linking an adjective to an entire phrase. With this construction, the phrase is simply added after て (with い-Adjectives ), or で (with nouns and な-Adjectives ), without any extra consideration for the phrase following it (this means that the (B) phrase will behave as if it was its own sentence). As with adjective +て, noun + で , it should be noted that て and で are different structures here. て is the same conjunction particle that is used with verbs (meaning that い-Adjectives are similar to verbs), while で is actually a form of だ that is used for conjugation. It is the same で as the one that is used in the formal version of だ , である . Which we will learn later.

About Adjective + て + B The  て  form of an  い-Adjective , or  で  form of a noun (or  な-Adjective ) is exactly the same as the  て  form of a verb, in that it carries the meaning of 'and', and is used for linking.

Caution Like other  て  forms ( ている 1 ,  ている 2 , and  ている 3 ), the  て  (or  で ) form of other words can have several possible meanings. These meanings are as follows.
Linking - Like 'and' in English.
Reasons - Like 'with (A)', or 'because of (A)' in English.
Manner - Like 'to do (B) in an (A) way' in English.
Caution As with all other conjugations of  いい , remember that it will be よくて, and not いくて.
Related Expand All
Adjective + て・Noun + で And... (Conjunctive)
N5 Grammar
Both of these patterns involve connecting an adjective or noun phrase to the rest of the sentence using the て form. The meaning of the connection depends on context. Sometimes it simply links words, as in 大きくてきれい ('big and pretty'), while in other cases, the first part may provide a reason for the second, as in 甘くておいしい ('sweet and tasty').
し～し  And, Giving reasons
N4 Grammar
し～し lists multiple reasons, similar to 'because of A, B, and so on' in English. In contrast, Adjective + て + B just connects adjectives. While it can imply the first quality supports the second (e.g. 甘くておいしい = 'sweet and delicious'), it doesn't suggest a broader conclusion. し often implies one, as in 甘いし、おいしいし, meaning 'It's sweet and delicious… (so I like it).'
Examples --:--
りさ は 背 ( せ ) が 高 ( たか ) くて かわい い です 。
Risa is  tall and  cute.
静 ( しず ) かで 平和 ( へいわ ) な ところ に 住 ( す ) み たい 。
I want to live in a  quiet and  peaceful place.
ほろさん は 親切 ( しんせつ ) で 優 ( やさ ) し い 。
Holo is  kind and  gentle.
「ルフィさん は 明 ( あか ) るくて いい 人 ( ひと ) です よ ね 。」 「そう です よ 。」
'Luffy is a  bright and  good-natured person, isn't he?' 'That's right.'
新田 ( にった ) さん は 悲 ( かな ) しくて 寂 ( さび ) し かった んです 。
Nitta was (used to be)  sad and  lonely.

Related Expand All
Verb + て+ B And, And then, After that (sequence)
N5 Grammar
Adjective + て, Noun + で, and Verb + て+ B are the same fundamental pattern, using the て form to connect elements in a sentence. The construction of the て form depends on whether the word is an い-Adjective, な-Adjective, noun, or verb, but the function remains consistent, similar to the English 'and.'
なくて To not ~ and ~, Not ~ and ~ (Conjugations)
N4 Grammar
Adjective + て or Noun + で is used to connect adjective or noun phrases with the rest of the sentence, similar to the English 'and.' なくて is similar, but connects phrases that are in the negative (ない) form. For example, 安くてよかった means 'I'm glad it was inexpensive,' while 高くなくてよかった would mean 'I'm glad that it wasn't expensive'.

title: Adjective + の(は)

patterns: ［な］Adjective + な + の + は(1)［い］Adjective + の + は(1)(1) が、も

variants.standard: ［な］Adjective + な + の + は(1)［い］Adjective + の + は(1)(1) が、も

cautions: Caution の may be used more than once in the same sentence, referring to the same noun.
about: One of the roles that the particle の can take in Japanese is replacing a noun that has already been mentioned, or one that has not been mentioned yet. In this way, it is similar to 'the one that (A)' in English. When using this expression, we will need to use な before の , when a な-Adjective is being used. When using this expression, の will be followed by は , が , or も , depending on what the speaker/writer wants to express.

online.title: Meaning of 「〜の(は)」 after an adjective

offline.book: [DBJG] A Dictionary of Basic Japanese Grammar

examples.sentence_text: 心配（しんぱい）なのはあなたです。
examples.translation: The one that is to be worried about is you.

examples.sentence_text: 熱（あつ）いのがこれです。
examples.translation: This is the one that is hot. (Specifically highlighting one thing out of several)

examples.sentence_text: 安（やす）いのはあのペンだ。
examples.translation: The one that is cheap is that pen. (Without much consideration for other things)

examples.sentence_text: 可愛（かわい）いのは私（わたし）の犬（いぬ）です。
examples.translation: The one that is cute is my dog.

sentence_structure.content: 私（わたし）の犬（いぬ）です。

examples.sentence_text: 冷（つめ）たいのも好（す）きです。
examples.translation: I also like the one that is cold.

examples.sentence_text: 新（あたら）しいのは彼（かれ）の車（くるま）だ。
examples.translation: The one that is new is his car.

examples.sentence_text: 元気（げんき）なのは社長（しゃちょう）です。
examples.translation: The one that is energetic is the manager.

examples.sentence_text: 難（むずか）しいのは歴史（れきし）だ。
examples.translation: The one that is difficult is history.

examples.sentence_text: 彼女（かのじょ）が素敵（すてき）なのは服（ふく）だけだ。
examples.translation: The only (one) thing that is great about her is her clothes.

related.title: のはXの方だ
related.comparison_text:
Ready to transform your studies? Learn N5 in under a month! Try now, no credit card required!
Try Bunpro Learn More Structure ［な］Adjective +  な  +  の  + は (1) ［い］Adjective  +  の  + は (1) (1) が 、 も
Details Part of Speech Expression
Word Type Case Marking Particle
Register Standard
About Adjective + の(は) One of the roles that the particle  の  can take in Japanese is replacing a noun that has already been mentioned, or one that has not been mentioned yet. In this way, it is similar to 'the one that (A)' in English. When using this expression, we will need to use  な  before  の , when a  な-Adjective  is being used.
When using this expression,  の  will be followed by  は ,  が , or  も , depending on what the speaker/writer wants to express.
Caution の  may be used more than once in the same sentence, referring to the same noun.
Synonyms Expand All
のはXの方だ It is...that..., It is...who..., ...is the one that..., ...is the one who...
N3 Grammar
Both structures single out and highlight something. That is, expressing '(A) is the one that (B)'. Adjective + の(は) is the simpler form, e.g. 新しいのはどっち？ ('Which one is new?') のはXの方だ expands on this to specify and contrast. A common use is in insistent apologies, e.g. いいえ、謝らないといけないのは僕のほうだ ('No, I'm the one who needs to apologize.')
の Verb nominalizer, The one who..., That which...
N5 Grammar
Both of these patterns use の to turn a phrase into a noun. For example, the verb 走る ('to run') becomes 走るのが好き ('I like running') because the subject marker が must follow a noun. The Adjective + の(は) pattern works similarly, turning adjectives into noun phrases (e.g., 赤い ('red') becomes 赤いのはきれいです ('The red one is pretty')).
Related Expand All
Particle + の Combined particles
N3 Grammar
Particle + の is used when particles like から, と, へ, で, or まで combine with の to describe a noun. For example, 先生への手紙 means 'a letter to (my) teacher,' and 駅までの道 means 'the road to the station.' Adjective + の(は) is a pattern where の replaces a noun, allowing the adjective to form a descriptive phrase. For example, 高いのはこれです means 'This is the expensive one.'
Examples --:--
新 ( あたら ) し い のは 彼 ( かれ ) の 車 ( くるま ) だ 。
The one that  is new is his car.
元気 ( げんき ) なのは 社長 ( しゃちょう ) です 。
The one that  is energetic is the manager.
難 ( むずか ) し い のは 歴史 ( れきし ) だ 。
The one that  is difficult is history.
彼女 ( かのじょ ) が 素敵 ( すてき ) なのは 服 ( ふく ) だけ だ 。
The  only ( one ) thing  that  is great about her is her clothes.
暑 ( あつ ) い のも 好 ( す ) き だ から 、エアコン が なく てもいい 。
I  also  like the  heat , so it's alright if I don't have an air conditioner.

pasi
Why does 「この家の中で一番明るい部屋はどれ？」息子の部屋が一番明るい の  not take のは? Is it just because it is at the end of the sentence? The grammar point text doesn’t give any examples of it without the second particle.
NinToaster
I would guess that its informal speech and thus the は particle is removed to make it easier to say since its already known in the previous sentence (Case Omission).
Kattosan
I’m guessing that is a explanatory の.
